alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Castle, northwestern Kent, southeastern Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Saint Georges to near Delaney Corner. Movement was north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Middletown, Pennsville, Westtown, Smyrna, Elsmere, New Castle, Clayton, Delaware City, Newport, Stanton, North Star, Glasgow, Bear, Talleyville, Port Penn, Wilmington Manor, Elam and Pike Creek. This includes Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 2 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central and northern Delaware. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
